thread.title: Man, 80, pleads guilty in pot bust, still challenging search - Massachusetts news
thread.title_full: Man, 80, pleads guilty in pot bust, still challenging search - Massachusetts news

author: boston.com
title: Man, 80, pleads guilty in pot bust, still challenging search - Massachusetts news
text:
BOSTON (AP) â€” An 80-year-old man has pleaded guilty to running a massive marijuana-dealing and money-laundering operation.
The Boston Globe reports (http://bit.ly/1MGmnE6 ) Marshall Dion is scheduled to be sentenced on Feb. 11 after pleading guilty Thursday under an agreement with prosecutors. He faces up to seven years in prison.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Police pulled Dion over for speeding in Junction City, Kansas, in 2013 and searched his pickup truck, finding nearly $850,000. Investigators later found $2 million in a bank account, $880,000 in an Arizona building and nearly 400 pounds of marijuana and $11 million at a storage facility in North Reading, Massachusetts.
Prosecutors said Dion sold about 6,600 to 22,000 pounds of marijuana dating back to 1992.
Dion maintains police searched his truck unconstitutionally and is appealing. His lawyer says he is embracing his responsibility.
___
Information from: The Boston Globe, http://www.bostonglobe.com
